import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Cabin'].fillna('Unknown', inplace=True)
X_train['Embarked'].fillna(X_train['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X_train['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X_train['Sex'])
X_train['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X_train['Embarked'])

# Create dummy variables for cabin
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Cabin'], prefix='Cabin', drop_first=True)

# Prepare test data
X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values in test data
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Cabin'].fillna('Unknown', inplace=True)
X_test['Embarked'].fillna(X_test['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables in test data
X_test['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(X_test['Sex'])
X_test['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(X_test['Embarked'])

# Create dummy variables for cabin in test data
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['Cabin'], prefix='Cabin', drop_first=True)

# Ensure all columns in test are in train
for col in X_train.columns:
    if col not in X_test.columns:
        X_test[col] = 0

# Align columns
X_test = X_test[X_train.columns]

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

X_train['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X_train['Embarked'])

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop non-numeric, non-useful columns: Name, Ticket, Cabin
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Embarked'].fillna(X_train['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X_train['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X_train['Sex'])
X_train['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X_train['Embarked'])

# Prepare test data
X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values in test data
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Embarked'].fillna(X_test['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables in test data
X_test['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(X_test['Sex'])
X_test['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(X_test['Embarked'])

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
